hypothesis: Fire degree predicts LINK/FL ratio (stability proxy)

methodology_note.NOT_the_same_as: C494 'escape rate' which uses qo_density (morphological prefix)
methodology_note.terminology_resolution: Two distinct escape concepts exist: qo_density (thermal intensity) and FQ_density (flow control). This test uses FQ_density.

verdict: SUPPORT - Higher fire -> lower LINK/FL (less stable)

interpretation.rationale: LINK and FL are complementary phases (C807). Higher fire needs more escape handling (FL) relative to monitoring (LINK).
interpretation.regime_4_clarification: R4 has lowest qo_density (thermal) but highest FQ_density (flow). These are orthogonal: precision processing uses gentle heat but needs high error correction.

escape_definition_comparison.note: Nearly inverse rankings confirm these measure different phenomena
